page.title: 19Blackford Hall Near Stoke
page.content: GOOD COMPANIONS LOCAL HISTORY:We talked to pensioners at a O.A.P.club the good companions.They left school from the ages 10-14.The girls went into service.Bus to Norwich was 4.d but most people walked.There was 1 school - The Old School,but its shut down.The village hall was built for soldiers in the 1st world war and is still standing. BLACKFORD HALL FARM:1 of the eldest surviving buildings,the moated white farmhouse dates back to Henry II and is partly flint covered.3 windows survive from its early history.The other brick building dates from the late 19th Century.There is supposed to be a ghost on the farm called'Tillet', who died driving a horse and cart across a frozen pond,he arrives on a stormy night to the sound of cart wheels.
